reviews.text: We had a lovely 2 week all inclusive stay in September 2012. We went for a friends wedding and didn't get a choice of where to stay so we were a little doubtful after reading other peoples comments. The reviews we read said the food was bland and repetitive - Wrong. We experienced top rate food and a huge variety for all. Vegetarians and fish lovers were well catered for, but not so for big meat lovers. There was not much beef on the buffet, although one evening we did have steak with a choice of sauces. A section of the restaurant was reserved for children and looked just like a small nursery, with small tables and chairs. The children even had their own buffet consisting of nuggets, burgers, smily faces and chips!! What more can you ask for. Adults were treated to themed dining. Such as Greek food night, Italian night and of course traditional Cyprus food evening - all complete with entertainment from that country, ie. Greek dancing etc after dinner. Lunch was on a lovely terrace by the pool with views over the harbour. The chefs prepared the food infront of you and often replenished the buffet so all the food was fresh. The salad bar was well stocked and fresh friut was always available for those who didnt want much to eat. We never had any snacks as we eat 3 meals a day and that was enough! The bars were open 11 - 11 for all inclusive and you could buy drinks after 11pm. The staff were very nice and gave excellent service. Champagne was not included in the all inclusive. They gave bottles of it away as prizes. We won a bottle on the music quiz night.
reviews.title: Great stay with a wedding too!

reviews.text: I went with my family to my sisters wedding within the hotel, on arrival we where greeted by the bell boy who was very helpful, We then checked in and was told if we needed anything not to hesitate in ringing the reception. When we where shown too our room which was a triple room consisting of 3 single beds I noticed there was only 1 pillow each. I rang reception and asked for 3 more which they brought them up straight away. We found everything in the room very clean, the maids came everyday to make the beds, clean the room ect nothing was to much trouble for them. We ate in the resturant 3 times a day, we where welcomed by the staff with open arms and by the end of the week they knew us well enough to put us in our regular seats. The selection of food changed daily there was always plenty of choice and always topped up.The pool was cleaned every morning, we had beach/pool towels in our rooms which we could take to the lesuire room to change if needed we could do this as many times as we needed.. The facilitys where amazing as where the staff always smartly dressed and willing to help.The childrens entertainment team was fantastic they made a real effort , by the end of the week they knew us by our first names as did we. There was entertainment through out the day if you wanted it but if you just wanted to chill by the pool that was fine too.The view from pool side over the beach was fab and only a few steps down to the beach. We had our hair and nails done in the on site beauty parlour the staff there where lovely nothing to much trouble they gave us glasses of champain when we had our treatments.The indoor pool and spa was also lovely it was a little cold when you first get in but fine after a few seconds. The on site shop sells most things but anything you cant find there is a shop just a few mins away. There is a bus stop right outside the shop taking you into town we personally didint leave the hotel only to go to the shop as it had everything we needed. My only little moan would be not enough toilets. They need some by the pool side and in the resturant as the toilets are down stairs yes there are lifts but when you have children toilets on all levels would be ideal. We had a fantastic time the wedding was amazing nothing was too much trouble its a beautiful setting and we cant wait to go back again in 2013/2014.
reviews.title: Perfect setting for a wedding or chill time!!

reviews.text: We stay here every year. The location is perfect. Away from the 'brits abroad' feel of Protaras itself but still with restaurants and shops within walking distance, the hotel is situated right on the beach with a beautiful harbour and small church. The grounds are well kept with a lovely pool and restaurant looking out over the sea. There is always a great range of food on offer at the buffet and the service is excellent, especially Deputy Maitre D', Panikkos. He makes us feel very welcome and always has time for us. The rooms are slightly dated however the rest of the hotel has been greatly improved and no doubt the rooms will be next.
reviews.title: Highly recommended!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are always many weddings taking place here and they always look well organised. I would imagine the photos would look fantastic as the surroundings are so picturesque.
reviews.title: Not our favored hotel to stay in Protaras

reviews.text: Loved the location with the little harbour and beach which was having sand spread on it on our first day. We were the last to be delivered to the hotel and its location means excursions begin horribly early so although we had not intended to rent a car we did so. The room was disappointing. Next to the cleaners store with a balcony overlooking a service yard we disliked it so much we enquired about an upgrade to be cursorily dismissed by the only unhelpful member of staff we met. Rest of the staff were lovely and worked very hard to keep guests happy. Only one wedding while we were there but we were told that in high season there can be 5 each day! The hotel was just opening for the season and we enjoyed not having to worry about claiming a sunbed or a bit of sand. Food was excellent - but occasionally let down by being lukewarm or cold. Otherwise variety and quality the best we have ever experienced in an all inclusive hotel. Swimming pool was cold but it was the first week. We were there as a couple but this would be a good choice for families - excellent animation team kept the children amused literally from morning till night. We really enjoyed our stay (despite the room) and would return.
reviews.title: Lovely staff, good location and best ever food in an all inclusive

reviews.text: Stayed here for a week on a half board basis, cant really fault the hotel itself, bit out of town but very easy to walk or hop on a bus to the nearest bars, restrauants, very clean hotel, large grounds, lots of sunbeds, rooms are quite spacious, very polite and friendly staff and quick to respond to any minor issues raised with them, honestly cannot fault the accomodation, free safe deposit boxes as well, a bonus. although you do have to pay for your fridge if you want to use it .
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and location let down by the food.

reviews.text: One very good thing was being allowed to have either our lunch in the restruant or our evening meal, breakfast has many many choices but it's all tepid, I know it must take some arranging

reviews.text: Got married there in oct & got charged again for the chaple besides been charged in England . The food is terrible we had to eat out even though all inclusive . The local drink they charged for ,the family room was a pull out bed setee so there was no room to move had to have suitcases on the balcony . They didn't help or ask if I would like to store my wedding dress . Because they had made the children's bed up & put the backing of the setee against the window when heat from outside hit the cold from the cold in it broke the window & on the day of the wedding I had five work men in the SMALL family room fixing it . Never got the cleaners to come in & change the children's bed after in case any glass had gone on their bed .had to have them in our bed on the wedding night . Reception was rude I could go on as it was endless . Pool was infected half of the holiday makers walking round with ear infections that included me & my children. For the money me & my family paid it wasn't worth it other hotels around 3 star where loads better service my friends had stopped in at the time & if you do go don't go with Thomas cook the reps are useless but thomsons helped their holiday makers . I do have pictures which I WILL be putting up
reviews.title: Would NOT!!recommend this hotel should be a 3 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had our wedding (and honeymoon) at the golden coast hotel and we have to say we had a FANTASTIC time!!! The hotel was just perfect with beautiful grounds and chapel. All of our guests loved staying there. The staff were superb, very friendly and helpful. We also used an independent wedding co-ordinator company called MARRY IN CYPRUS to organise our wedding of 40 guests and they were second to none. Very helpful and able to organise things to the minute detail. Many of our guests told us that it was the best wedding they had been to and they all would love to come to Cyprus again. Highly recommend not only the hotel but the wedding planners as well. We were EXTREAMLY happy.
reviews.title: Our October Cyprus Wedding
